config.history:
Overview
Reiner is one of Arel’s earliest companions and a recurring supporting character in Hero Without a Class: Who Even Needs Skills?!. Unlike Arel, Reiner possesses an advanced combat class. Her growth alongside Arel highlights the contrast between system-reliant strength and self-earned ability.

Initially skeptical of Arel’s classless status, Reiner gradually becomes one of his most reliable allies, serving as both a grounding presence and a benchmark for traditional progression within the series.

Appearance
Reiner has a sturdy build typical of a frontline fighter, with a short Ponytail, Red hair and no-nonsense adventurer attire. Her equipment is conventional but well-maintained, reflecting her disciplined and methodical approach to combat rather than flashy specialization.

Personality
Straightforward, earnest, and occasionally blunt, Reiner values hard work and clearly defined rules. Early on, she struggles to reconcile Arel’s success with his lack of class, having been raised to believe the system is absolute. However, Reiner is not cruel or dismissive by nature—her skepticism stems from confusion rather than malice.

As the story progresses, she becomes increasingly open-minded, developing respect for Arel’s perseverance and adaptability. Reiner often acts as the voice of reason within the group, balancing Arel’s unconventional approach with practical caution.


Advertisement
Abilities
Reiner’s abilities stem from her official combat class (Power Swordsman), granting her reliable, structured skills that excel in traditional adventuring scenarios.

Solid Frontline Combatant: Excels at direct engagement and enemy control
Class-Based Skill Proficiency: Makes efficient use of abilities granted by the system
Team-Oriented Fighter: Functions best when supporting or coordinating with allies
While not portrayed as exceptional by elite standards, Reiner’s consistency and teamwork make her a dependable party member.

Combat Style
Reiner favors straightforward tactics, prioritizing defense, positioning, and sustained pressure. Her fighting style contrasts with Arel’s adaptive, freeform approach, reinforcing the thematic divide between structured power and flexible growth.

Relationship with Arel
Reiner’s relationship with Arel evolves from skepticism to mutual respect. Witnessing Arel overcome class disadvantages through sheer effort forces Reiner to confront the limitations of the system she trusted. Over time, she becomes one of Arel’s strongest supporters, often defending him against criticism from others.

Their dynamic serves as a narrative lens through which the audience explores the series’ core question: Is strength granted—or earned?
